tool_description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 365,000 recipes and 86,000 food products. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, Primal, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Whole 30. We will soon be adding Weight Watcher points, too.
name: Recipe - Food - Nutrition
title: Recipe - Food - Nutrition

api_list.name: Create Recipe Card (Deprecated)
api_list.description: Create a recipe card given a recipe.

required_parameters.name: backgroundImage
required_parameters.description: The background image ("none","background1", or "background2").

required_parameters.name: readyInMinutes
required_parameters.description: The number of minutes it takes to get the recipe on the table.

required_parameters.name: title
required_parameters.description: The title of the recipe.

required_parameters.name: image
required_parameters.description: The binary image of the recipe as jpg.

required_parameters.name: mask
required_parameters.description: The mask to put over the recipe image ("ellipseMask", "diamondMask", "diamondMask", "starMask", "heartMask", "potMask", "fishMask").

required_parameters.name: instructions
required_parameters.description: The instructions to make the recipe. One step per line.

required_parameters.name: ingredients
required_parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

required_parameters.name: servings
required_parameters.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

optional_parameters.name: fontColor
optional_parameters.description: The font color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

optional_parameters.name: backgroundColor
optional_parameters.description: The background color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

api_list.name: Recipe Nutrition Widget
api_list.description:
Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as HTML including CSS. 

Full example code of how to work with widgets can be found in our [spoonacular-widget GitHub](https://github.com/ddsky/spoonacular-widgets).

required_parameters.name: servings
required_parameters.description: The number of servings.

required_parameters.name: ingredientList
required_parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

optional_parameters.name: showBacklink
optional_parameters.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular.

optional_parameters.name: defaultCss
optional_parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

api_list.name: Detect Food in Text
api_list.description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts.

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.description: The text in which food items such as dish names and ingredients should be detected in.
required_parameters.default: I like to eat delicious tacos. Only cheeseburger with cheddar are better than that. But then again, pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and tomatoes is so good!

api_list.name: Image Analysis (File)
api_list.description: Classify and analyze a food image.

api_list.name: Compute Shopping List
api_list.description: Compute a shopping list from a set of simple foods. This endpoint does not require usernames.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mealplanner/shopping-list/compute"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mealplanner/shopping-list/compute"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Generate Shopping List
api_list.description: Generate the shopping list for a user from the meal planner in a given time frame.

required_parameters.name: end-date
required_parameters.description: The end date in the format yyyy-mm-dd.

required_parameters.name: hash
required_parameters.description: The private hash for the username.

required_parameters.name: start-date
required_parameters.description: The start date in the format yyyy-mm-dd.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username.

api_list.name: Add to Shopping List
api_list.description: Add an item to the current shopping list of a user.

required_parameters.name: hash
required_parameters.description: The private hash for the username.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username.

api_list.name: Add Meal Plan Template
api_list.description: Add a meal plan template for a user.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username.

required_parameters.name: hash
required_parameters.description: The private hash for the username.

api_list.name: Add to Meal Plan
api_list.description: Add an item to the user's meal plan. The Add to Meal Plan endpoint is complex, be sure to review the [guide here](https://spoonacular.com/food-api/docs#Add-to-Meal-Plan)

required_parameters.name: hash
required_parameters.description: The private hash for the username.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username.

api_list.name: Classify Grocery Product Bulk
api_list.description: Provide a set of product jsons, get back classified products.

optional_parameters.name: locale
optional_parameters.description: The display name of the returned category, supported is en_US (for American English) and en_GB (for British English).

api_list.name: Compute Glycemic Load
api_list.description: Retrieve the glycemic index for a list of ingredients and compute the individual and total glycemic load.

api_list.name: Parse Ingredients
api_list.description: Extract an ingredient from plain text.

required_parameters.name: ingredientList
required_parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

required_parameters.name: servings
required_parameters.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

optional_parameters.name: includeNutrition
optional_parameters.description: Whether nutrition data should be added to correctly parsed ingredients.

api_list.name: Analyze Recipe
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to send raw recipe information, such as title, servings, and ingredients, to then see what we compute (badges, diets, nutrition, and more). This is useful if you have your own recipe data and want to enrich it with our semantic analysis.

api_list.name: Analyze Recipe Instructions
api_list.description: Extract ingredients and equipment from the recipe instruction steps.

required_parameters.name: instructions
required_parameters.description: The instructions text.
required_parameters.default: Put the garlic in a pan and then add the onion.

api_list.name: Connect User
api_list.description:
In order to call user-specific endpoints, you need to connect your app's users to spoonacular users.

Just call this endpoint with your user's information and you will get back a username and hash that you must save on your side. In future requests that you make on this user's behalf you simply pass their username and hash alongside your API key.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com/users/connect"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com/users/connect"

headers = {

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Map Ingredients to Grocery Products
api_list.description: Map a set of ingredients to products you can buy in the grocery store.

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "spoonacular-recipe-food-nutrition-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.description: Given a grocery product title, this endpoint allows you to detect what basic ingredient it is.

optional_parameters.name: locale
optional_parameters.description: The locale of the returned category, supported is en\_US and en\_GB.
